newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkey's Ciller chairs party meeting amid turmoil.
newsitem.headline: Turkey's Ciller chairs party meeting amid turmoil.

text.p: Turkish Deputy Prime Minister Tansu Ciller went into an unscheduled meeting of her True Path Party (DYP) on Friday after a newspaper report that she planned to withdraw from the Islamist-led coalition.
Ciller declined to answer journalists' questions on entering the meeting at party headquarters.
A minister in Ciller's faction said earlier he did not expect her to quit the alliance over a growing dispute between the government and the army.
The Yeni Yuzyil daily quoted unnamed cabinet ministers as saying Ciller, also the foreign minister, had decided to pull the DYP out of the 10-month-old government over
State Minister Salim Ensarioglu, a member of True Path, said he was unaware of any attempt by Ciller to ditch government partner Prime Minister Necmettin Erbakan, Turkey's first Islamist leader.
"I have no information on such a decision. I don't expect a withdrawal," he told Reuters.
Turkish stocks were little changed in early trade on Friday. Shares dropped 4.9 percent on Thursday on fears the alliance was crumbling.
"The feeling among the DYP is that Ciller has definitely decided to pull out," wrote Yeni Yuzyil columnist Bilal Cetin, a leading political analyst.
Ciller's faction is uneasy at the Erbakan's failure to implement an anti-Islamist crackdown demanded by the powerful army.
Erbakan will face the generals at a meeting of the National Security Council on Saturday that has been billed as a showdown.
